data.name: Admiration
data.description: A blend of honey and boysenberries.  The boysenberries and honey balance each other, this mead pairs well with any dish.  The latest batch is made with EVEN more boysenberries, which adds even more fruit notes... YUMMY!

style.name: Semi-Sweet Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a semisweet (or medium-dry) white wine, with a pleasant mixture of honey character, light sweetness, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Moonlight Meadery
breweries.description:
It all started back in 1995, when Michael tried a cyser (apple and honey mead) for the first time.  Since that first sip Michael has developed a passion, and a masterful skill at making international award winning meads. Michael Fairbrother has started Moonlight Meadery™, with a mission to bring ultra premium meads to the market place.  It is more than a product and it is more than a process, it's our obsession.

"Mead to me is passion, it's about living and love, it's about enjoyment, family and friends, and sharing." says Michael Fairbrother, Founder and Mead Maker. 

Our meads will be unique, and unlike anything you have ever tried, you will find it incredible!   We are going to embrace the unique nature of natural honey as minimally processed as possible.

data.name: Apple Pie Mead
data.description:
14% ABV sweet Cyser. Made from raw Sonoma coast honey, fresh pressed organic Sonoma Co. apples and organic spices. Aged over 1 year in stainless.
Apple Pie in a glass!

breweries.name: B. Nektar Meadery
breweries.description:
Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).

data.name: Blackberry
data.description: This earthy, brightly acidic mead balances the berries’ slightly smoky, plummy notes, a medium sweetness and the lingering tartness of this delicious bramble. Made with raw, unfiltered honey & whole blackberries this mead is intensely fruity with balanced acidity and earthy aroma.
data.foodPairings: This hand-crafted medium-sweet mead pairs well with creamy cheeses, duck, veal, and good company.

data.name: Blossom
data.description: Our Cyser (mead made from apples and honey)  is made from Sunnycrest Apple cider of Londonderry NH, the  fresh pressed apples add a tart start with semi-sweet finish.  Such a light, refreshing taste it can accompany any dish that is rich in flavor or just enjoyed as a festive or aperitif wine, pairs well with cheese plates, poultry or just on its own. This recipe has won awards over the last 15 years, and most recently a Bronze at the 2013 Silver Medal winner at the 2013 Mazer Cup International competition.

data.name: Blue Honey Melomel
data.description: Blue Honey Melomel is a semi-sweet melomel mead that is crafted with 100% raw Ohio wildflower honey, farm raised Great Lakes blueberries, water, and yeast.  This blueberry melomel is then aged on French oak staves for 3 months to provide added depth and complexity.  Make sure to store away an extra bottle for later because this mead ages wonderfully.

breweries.name: Crafted Artisan Meadery
breweries.description: Located in rural Northeast Ohio Crafted Artisan Meadery specializes in award-winning handcrafted Mead.  Through the labors of the honeybees and flora around us we transform their work into one of the oldest fermented beverages in the world. We use the finest locally sourced ingredients and pride ourselves on providing the highest quality Mead to our customers.  Taste something Crafted!

data.name: Blueberry Honey Wine
data.description: Although our Blueberry Mead recipe is very similar to the Traditional the 5% of blueberries added during primary fermentation completely transforms the flavor. Since we do not use any sulfites to stop fermentation, the blueberries ferment out all the way leaving behind no residual sugar, providing this mead with an ultra dry quality while still retaining the refreshing clean finish that always leaves you  wanting more. Unlike the Traditional, the Blueberry Mead has an earthy bouquet and flower aromas from the pollen in the honey. We use honey provided by Garey Farms in Paris, Kentucky which varies depending on the blooms in the area.   This wine is best chilled as well and goes really well with Brie and fruit and would be perfect for a picnic on a warm, sunny day.

breweries.name: Redstone Meadery
breweries.description:
David Myers, known as 'Chairman of the Mead', founder of Redstone Meadery, is a romantic and wants to see mead once again enjoying the glory days of yesteryear. He started the Boulder, Colorado company with the 'natural philosophy' that he produce the highest quality honey wine on the market.

Because of this 'philosophy of mead', Redstone does not cork (to avoid oxidation) but instead uses swing top bottles. This ensures the mead will not breathe while cellaring plus offers a much longer shelf life once the bottle has been opened.

In keeping with the 'natural' approach, Redstone does not add any sulfites, a known allergen, as honey is it's own natural preservative. Redstone only pasteurizes the must (unfermented mead) and never boils. The company strives to feature the flavors of the fermentable as much as possible.

In 2003 Redstone Meadery brought the International Mead Festival (www.meadfest.com) to Boulder, Colorado and with that helped to establish mead as its own beverage category. Also at this time Redstone spearheaded the creation of the International Mead Association (www.meadfest.org) to help promote and educate the masses about the world's first fermented beverage.

Currently, Redstone products are distributed to 20 states across the U.S., making it the widest distributed wine from the state of Colorado and one of the most widely distributed meads in the country! From the Northwest to the Southeast, Ask for Mead!

style.name: Semi-Sweet Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a semisweet (or medium-dry) white wine, with a pleasant mixture of honey character, light sweetness, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Nectar Creek
breweries.description: Nectar Creek Honeywine was created by two brothers with a contagious energy to redefine the world's oldest fermented beverage as a new and artful libation. All of our mead is handcrafted in small batches using the best ingredients the Pacific Northwest has to offer, highlighting specific blends of Willamette Valley honey, water and yeast to produce a sensational pint

data.name: Cricket Song
data.description: Just as the cricket chirped at sunset for the villagers of the place of many trees, we too now give you a melody of the bitter and the sweat. Imported Guatemalan green beans, roasted and cold brewed in Grand Rapids, fused with honey, and forged into that perfect harmony between mead and kava. Evening is fast approaching. Wake up and dance to the sweet rhythms of our Cricket Song.

style.name: Semi-Sweet Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a semisweet (or medium-dry) white wine, with a pleasant mixture of honey character, light sweetness, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Arktos Meadery
breweries.description:
For more than 9,000 years, the fermentation of honey has helped define culture and shape history. Early Slavic trading, Norse Mythology, Vedic Hymns of India, Old English Epics, 19th century Russian Literature, all of these acts or works, not to mention the contemplations of many a great mind of ancient Greece, have taken part in documenting and contributing to the continuing history of what we commonly refer to as Honey Wine or Mead making.

Arktos Meadery is now one more step in this evolutionary process. Nature has so graciously provided us with all the ingredients necessary for the production of this Nectar of the Gods. Now it is our responsibility to take these fruits, spices, and yeasts and combine them with those two wonderfully simple ingredients of honey and water for the purpose of continuing the hallowed tradition of making mead.

It is our hope and intention to provide each and every one of our mead drinkers with the finest, simplest and most natural mead possible. Oh, that sweet, sweet nectar…

data.name: Curiosity
data.description: Curiosity is made by aging our wildflower honey mead in barrels for 2 years, where wild funky yeasts went to work, now we can't tell you about where we obtained the barrels for fear that it would be misleading, but we wish we could, #ChangeTheGame. You will note the lightest sour tang on the sides of your tongue, with slight impression from the oak of soft hints of coconut and vanilla.

data.name: Destiny
data.description: We took one of our flagship meads, Desire, and we aged it for an additional year in one of our Utopian barrels.  The oak firms up the back currant, black cherry, and blueberry notes with just the right amount of tannins.  Refined and incredibly tasty.

data.name: Evil Genius
data.description: In an obscure industrial lair resides the man known only as the evil Dr. I.P.A. Using his hadron colider, hidden deep underground, he has conducted his most remarkable experiment to-date. The result is a perfect balance of honey and hops. But there are side-effects... His lab rats can't get enough of the stuff. And soon, neither will you. Introducing the Evil Genius. The big bang is no longer a theory, it's your reality.

data.name: Frisky
data.description: Are you inclined to frisk?  Enjoy a little "Joie de vivre" with this rollicking honey blueberry maple wine.  Light, playful and every so tasty.  Think Wild with a frisky touch of maple syrup.  Aged in our Utopian barrels, and we added a touch more maple.

data.name: Frontier
data.description: Frontier is our dry-hopped session mead. It carries the aromas of tangerine and passion fruit, with notes of pineapple, citrus, and bubble gum. Petillant, with a medium-light body, and a well-rounded, balanced finish. Just enough honey sweetness to balance the hop flavor, without hop bitterness found in beer.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

data.name: Hop Nectar
data.description: Hop Nectar is a semi-sweet metheglin mead that is crafted with 100% raw Ohio wildflower honey, water, and yeast.  This traditional mead is then dry hopped with Cascade Hops prior to bottling for a perfectly balanced profile.  Ohio wildflower honey provides the perfect platform for showcasing the king of American hops.

data.name: Huajilla Traditional
data.description: Huajilla traditional mead showcasing the mild honey from southwest Texas. Delicate honey, with light citrus, apple, and a natural complex spice. Semisweet with a soft finish. Perfect mead for a cool fall afternoon.

data.name: Je t'aime
data.description:
Somethings happen once in a blue moon, on August 31st 2012 Michael & Berniece married... Please join Michael & Berniece in the celebration of their wedding with a toast of JE T'AIME, made from Tupelo Blossom honey will dance and twinkle like a bride and groom on their wedding day.

Silver Medal winner at the 2013 Mazer Cup International

style.name: Semi-Sweet Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a semisweet (or medium-dry) white wine, with a pleasant mixture of honey character, light sweetness, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Moonlight Meadery
breweries.description:
It all started back in 1995, when Michael tried a cyser (apple and honey mead) for the first time.  Since that first sip Michael has developed a passion, and a masterful skill at making international award winning meads. Michael Fairbrother has started Moonlight Meadery™, with a mission to bring ultra premium meads to the market place.  It is more than a product and it is more than a process, it's our obsession.

"Mead to me is passion, it's about living and love, it's about enjoyment, family and friends, and sharing." says Michael Fairbrother, Founder and Mead Maker. 

Our meads will be unique, and unlike anything you have ever tried, you will find it incredible!   We are going to embrace the unique nature of natural honey as minimally processed as possible.

data.name: Mango Nectar
data.description: Made with mangos for a crisp , tart, acidic front and a floral, pink peppercorn finish.

style.name: Semi-Sweet Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a semisweet (or medium-dry) white wine, with a pleasant mixture of honey character, light sweetness, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Redstone Meadery
breweries.description:
David Myers, known as 'Chairman of the Mead', founder of Redstone Meadery, is a romantic and wants to see mead once again enjoying the glory days of yesteryear. He started the Boulder, Colorado company with the 'natural philosophy' that he produce the highest quality honey wine on the market.

Because of this 'philosophy of mead', Redstone does not cork (to avoid oxidation) but instead uses swing top bottles. This ensures the mead will not breathe while cellaring plus offers a much longer shelf life once the bottle has been opened.

In keeping with the 'natural' approach, Redstone does not add any sulfites, a known allergen, as honey is it's own natural preservative. Redstone only pasteurizes the must (unfermented mead) and never boils. The company strives to feature the flavors of the fermentable as much as possible.

In 2003 Redstone Meadery brought the International Mead Festival (www.meadfest.com) to Boulder, Colorado and with that helped to establish mead as its own beverage category. Also at this time Redstone spearheaded the creation of the International Mead Association (www.meadfest.org) to help promote and educate the masses about the world's first fermented beverage.

Currently, Redstone products are distributed to 20 states across the U.S., making it the widest distributed wine from the state of Colorado and one of the most widely distributed meads in the country! From the Northwest to the Southeast, Ask for Mead!

data.name: Mischief
data.description: As in the conduct or activity that playfully causes petty annoyance.  These Blackberries are deep in flavor and only enhanced by the heather honey notes, this wine will continue to age and mature over time.

data.name: Necromangocon
data.description:
Swallow this...

Many years ago, a mysterious book was discovered by a group of friends in a Ferndale, MI basement. A translation of its contents revealed the recipe for an ancient beverage using mango juice, honey, and black pepper. What they didn't realize was that creating the beverage had dire consequences. Stricken by fear after its compleation, the friends tried to contain the terrifying forces into this very bottle. Once opened, however, no one can say for sure if it can be conquered. Defend your soul or join us...

breweries.name: B. Nektar Meadery
breweries.description:
Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).

breweries.name: Arktos Meadery
breweries.description:
For more than 9,000 years, the fermentation of honey has helped define culture and shape history. Early Slavic trading, Norse Mythology, Vedic Hymns of India, Old English Epics, 19th century Russian Literature, all of these acts or works, not to mention the contemplations of many a great mind of ancient Greece, have taken part in documenting and contributing to the continuing history of what we commonly refer to as Honey Wine or Mead making.

Arktos Meadery is now one more step in this evolutionary process. Nature has so graciously provided us with all the ingredients necessary for the production of this Nectar of the Gods. Now it is our responsibility to take these fruits, spices, and yeasts and combine them with those two wonderfully simple ingredients of honey and water for the purpose of continuing the hallowed tradition of making mead.

It is our hope and intention to provide each and every one of our mead drinkers with the finest, simplest and most natural mead possible. Oh, that sweet, sweet nectar…

data.name: Queen Bee
data.description: Heed the bee and this queen will lead you to the gods. Our nectar, imbued with the sweet taste of Michigan Wildflower Honey, fermented, and then aged in custom oak, will transport you to a place only the ancient Greeks have known. Let the complex subtleties of our traditional honey wine bathe your senses in the honorable intentions of the Bee.

breweries.name: Starrlight Mead
breweries.description:
After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!

Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager
Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker

We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.

In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.

Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.

Saturdays from noon til 6 pm

data.name: Scorn
data.description: This is one of our limited release meads only available in limited quantities.  This mead is hot and spicy made with the addition of red chili peppers.  No dancing around with this one, it gets to the point.  The semi-sweet honey provides a wonderful dance floor for the chili peppers to add some heat, its complex, not one dimensional.  Enjoy with authentic Mexican dishes, or with some PEI mussels.

data.description: Peaches and citrus notes tantalize the tongue, balancing the honey to create a semi-sweet wine. This satisfying treat promises a succulent finish that like the definition of smitten, you will VERY much fall in love with.

data.name: Three Bears
data.description: Not too sweet. Not too sour. Just right. This Arktos staple finds that perfect balance of honey and blueberry by adding just a touch of blackberry tartness to our Three Bear melomel. Even Goldilocks couldn’t scoff at this bear necessity. Forget your worries and enjoy our interpretation of what old mother nature would have intended a Blueberry Melomel to be if only she had found the time.

data.name: Tupelo Mead
data.description: Tupelo is a semi-sweet traditional mead crafted with 100% raw Tupelo honey, water, and yeast.  Regarded as the gold standard of honey around the world, Tupelo honey is gathered for a few brief weeks in the Apalachicola River basin in the panhandle of Florida.  Our Tupelo Mead is handcrafted to showcase this rare and world renowned honey.

breweries.name: Crafted Artisan Meadery
breweries.description: Located in rural Northeast Ohio Crafted Artisan Meadery specializes in award-winning handcrafted Mead.  Through the labors of the honeybees and flora around us we transform their work into one of the oldest fermented beverages in the world. We use the finest locally sourced ingredients and pride ourselves on providing the highest quality Mead to our customers.  Taste something Crafted!

data.name: Utopian
data.description: Truly a unique mead that offers a flavor not just unlike any other mead but unlike any other beverage in the world. Our single barrel releases are limited and identified with bottling date and number of cases available. We aged and fermented this mead in hand-selected, Samuel Adams Utopias® casks from the award-winning Boston Beer Company.  This flavorful, slightly fruity mead has a sweet, complex flavor that is reminiscent of a deep, rich vintage port, fine cognac or aged sherry.  Back to back International Mazer Cup winner bronze 2012, and silver 2013.  Batch #8 now available.

style.name: Semi-Sweet Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a semisweet (or medium-dry) white wine, with a pleasant mixture of honey character, light sweetness, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Nectar Creek
breweries.description: Nectar Creek Honeywine was created by two brothers with a contagious energy to redefine the world's oldest fermented beverage as a new and artful libation. All of our mead is handcrafted in small batches using the best ingredients the Pacific Northwest has to offer, highlighting specific blends of Willamette Valley honey, water and yeast to produce a sensational pint
